intro: Paxia dewevrei, commonly known as the Dewevre's paxia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
